Class DataStorage

java.lang.Object
org.stockmanager.storage.DataStorage
public class DataStorage extends Object
Provides simple in-memory storage for user data, portfolios, and transactions. Designed for use in applications where data persistence is required. In a real-world scenario, this could be replaced with a file or database system.

  • Method Details

    • saveUser

      public void saveUser(User user)
      Saves or updates a user's data in the storage.
      Parameters:
      user - The user object to save.

    • getUser

      public User getUser(String username)
      Retrieves a user's data by their username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      Returns:
      The User object, or null if the user does not exist.

    • savePortfolio

      public void savePortfolio(String username, Portfolio portfolio)
      Saves or updates a portfolio for a specified user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      portfolio - The portfolio to save.

    • getPortfolio

      public Portfolio getPortfolio(String username)
      Retrieves the portfolio associated with a specific user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      Returns:
      The Portfolio object, or null if no portfolio exists for the user.

    • saveTransactions

      public void saveTransactions(String username, List<Transaction> userTransactions)
      Saves or updates transaction history for a user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      userTransactions - The list of transactions to save.

    • getTransactions

      public List<Transaction> getTransactions(String username)
      Retrieves the transaction history for a specified user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      Returns:
      A list of Transaction objects, or an empty list if no transactions exist.

    • userExists

      public boolean userExists(String username)
      Checks whether a user exists in the storage.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to check.
      Returns:
      true if the user exists, otherwise false.
